53469DC7E7144372A058E8E92C5FCF2E.description: Uses less precise words or expressions to replace unknown ones

A1DC2A63F7CD4397AC466CA05FE77B9C.description: Buys time to think out a response

6F950EA1E56449EFB8A238CA6FFC36CA.description: Uses appropriate stress and pronunciation for targeted words to carry out tasks (e.g. Chocolate: \' chä-clate\)

09D20D713428413EA327173AAD5E023F.description: Uses appropriate stress and pronunciation for words frequently used to participate in classroom life (e.g. Wednesday: \' wenz-day\)

0278C97DEF3F42B8BC9165DCC42D0510.description: Uses rising and falling voice pitch to convey meaning (e.g. rising voice pitch to express surprise: It’s snowing?_?)

314E435AA99F4848ACDC6904A73AAB1D.description: Uses targeted vocabulary related to texts (e.g. text components: subtitles)

5138E9A83D8E4079B2AEBCCB81E59393.description: Uses targeted vocabulary related to communication and learning strategies (e.g. skim: quick read)

3C06E547884C4006ACA2E04E6087E337.description: Uses information and communications technologies (e.g. networks

51CEFC48D7DD4949B0127CDC76A247DC.description: Uses targeted vocabulary related to the development of the cross-curricular competencies:

E9CA163B16524691A76147154CD729D4.description: Environmental Awareness and Consumer Rights and Responsibilities (e.g. pollution)

D56190D11EA0401686799E13E3AB8C11.description: Personal and Career Planning (Cycle 1) / Career Planning and Entrepreneurship (Cycle 2) (e.g. occupations)

F6FC57C97A854AA1AA70B57E1A4CE0A0.description: Uses targeted vocabulary related to issues inspired by the broad areas of learning:

312E92103EE842A6A537FADF69EBFEC4.description: Uses targeted vocabulary related to students’ interests and needs such as leisure activities, relationships, jobs (e.g. sports equipment

E91DF5DF7002477DAFCFE330FA6DC280.description: Uses targeted vocabulary related to the immediate environment such as classroom, home, community (e.g. stapler

2A52BFFD97044C8399582A5852B2E66C.description: Shares reflections about learning (e.g. I was able to understand this text because…, I used this strategy to…, I learned…)

813E38DCAAC3445FBD899BBDA81FF7EE.description: Sets short- and long-term learning goals (e.g. I will watch an English TV program tonight. By the end of the year, I will…, This year, I want to improve…)

1F88CAAD927041D4B79E9DB9846BB1F8.description: Uses discourse markers to link ideas (e.g. Then…, Next…, On the other hand…)

09B8975CD04A47FE8626296C5B7D4F15.description: Contributes to teamwork and harmonious exchanges (e.g. Do you want to be on our team? Interesting idea! Good work!)

5B5698D608974BA284BFE50D5BE9CAD8.description: Accepts or refuses invitations (e.g. Yes, I’d love to! I can’t make it. Sounds good to me.)

16017F19FF59447F9979FF766F991470.description: Invites others (e.g. Let’s go to…, Would you like to…? Do you want to join us?)

94AFBCE9EC224F12AECF1350313E7CF6.description: Asks for suggestions (e.g. Should I…? What do you suggest? Do you have a suggestion?)

80E721C4374A441AADA031C3356062C5.description: Makes suggestions (e.g. Let’s…, Maybe you should…, Why don’t we…?)

7E42C798AAC847E0AB492785913D83AE.description: Offers clarification (e.g. What I said was…, Let me explain..., I mean…)

161E4E04FAE248BDAE5B42807244EC47.description: Asks for clarification (e.g. Could you repeat, please? Can you say that another way? What does… mean?)

4BB7A809C78D4510821DD051CC130C16.description: Asks information questions (e.g. Who/What/Where/When/Why/How...? Does he…? Can they…? Are you...?)

034DA5208D0F4DA29639F519EAF54480.description: Asks about needs, wants and obligations (e.g. What do they need? What does she want? What do we have to do?)

5342FCBB17B84F4EAAC6F5FE8388B063.description: Expresses needs, wants and obligations (e.g. They need…, I really want…, We must…) a.

EA9BAA3448B34A9B96F7E212AC2AF3FD.description: Offers help/assistance (e.g. Do you want me to help you? I can help you with…, Let me give you a hand.)

40FCE1186E6549E1817284DB54EADBE2.description: Accepts or declines offers of help/assistance (e.g. No thanks. Sure, that’s fine. Yes, I’ll help you.)

F1F9EAEE4E0B4B34B4254E19A7D9CA45.description: Asks for help/assistance (e.g. How do you write…? How would you do this? Can you help me with…?)

8899B0BBD1AF43FEB7876701524EAE43.description: Participates in classroom life (e.g. Write this down. I would like to work with…, How was your weekend?)

AF5B0BA48AFE4915859B08DF769C2190.description: Asks for advice and feedback (e.g. What would you do? Could you give me your feedback on this? Would you have a look at …?)

89B91730EA2B4CB688F37FC21C5E7550.description: Gives advice and feedback (e.g. Why don’t you try…, If I were you, I would…, You could…)

0D971EB45BD84275BDDF422985A41EDC.description: Gives/refuses permission (e.g. Yes, go ahead. No you can’t. Sure, no problem.)

BC3B2128C25B48E485B0649A69815FF1.description: Asks for permission (e.g. May/Can I…? Do you mind if…? Is it all right if…?)

B6F5BB69174943A89EB51D0A1728D0E0.description: Asks about others’ decision/indecision (e.g. What have you decided? Have you made up your mind? What’s your decision?)

9EF91952E1154B348C7DD0B73B9487F2.description: Expresses decision/indecision (e.g. I decided that…, We choose this one. I’m not sure about this.)

4E7332B0BBD9477AB98D2D828C58A434.description: Asks about others’ interests, tastes and preferences (e.g. Which would you prefer? What’s your favourite…? Why do you like. . .?)

DDFDF16AE62C44D9A6E8B17603196FA6.description: Expresses interests, tastes and preferences (e.g. They like…, I can’t stand…, She prefers…)

BA4D8B2C8FC449E59D32ED30FF01B829.description: Asks about others’ feelings (e.g. How do you feel about…? Are you okay? Why is she sad?)

386D38264DB4404292CE880E2F25F578.description: Expresses feelings (e.g. I’m thrilled. She feels…, They're happy.)

7F94C50EF3434EE09A03CB4BEF2ADC64.description: Asks about capabilities (e.g. Do they know how to…? Can it…? Are you good at…?)

368BCA3F6D2E484A84C9DB6F6C2892D1.description: Expresses capabilities (e.g. He’s good at…, They are unable to…, I can/can’t…)

C58D623612DD47CB959E5B7F77597F4C.description: Asks others to support their opinions (e.g. Why do you say that? Why are you against…? What are your arguments?)

A197B0F0E50947E685B19C69B454C17B.description: Supports opinions (e.g. I believe this because..., For example…, Based on the text…)

0E55705C1C3B45908C295A64732DE4C0.description: Asks for others’ opinions (e.g. What do you think? What’s your opinion? Is he for or against…?)

9EBE93702E924FD19458AE667C46400E.description: States opinions (e.g. In my opinion…, I think that…, I’m for/against…)

9768445FC9A44A19A515834F3DD6D7F9.description: Asks if others are in agreement/disagreement (e.g. Do you agree? Who disagrees? Are you okay with…?)

6C7BF6A1889D4050A09AF164F67DD791.description: Expresses agreement/disagreement (e.g. Me too. I don’t think so. We don’t agree with...)

488A9C1894DD466A8EB936A3FFE24E43.description: Gives warnings (e.g. Watch out! Be careful! You’d better not…)

4A39E30DF712449F83CA507DCC0F3CA3.description: Invites other speakers to contribute to exchanges and to maintain interaction (e.g. What about you? Are you sure? What’s your point of view?)

EC06B1AC8DE0425780358847AD9CF252.description: Fills in pauses to maintain exchanges (e.g. I mean…, You know…, Well…)

3CFDD197A1D046E6A663B3024301002E.description: Indicates that more time is needed to figure out what to say and how to say it (e.g. Just a minute. Wait a second. Let me think.)

0F651767C9EB42DF9450D2DA5CC77BE5.description: Asks about events, experiences, ideas and issues (e.g. What does it look like? Can you tell me more about...)

9225A53C94104C5BBAF756305938CD78.description: Describes events, experiences, ideas and issues (e.g. This is about…, It was the best day of my life because...)

607833958E7C4CACBD34E3F49C9E809E.description: Asks about people, animals, objects, places (e.g. Who are they? Where is it? What’s your…?)

ED50F2444B314FACB498801C0F407198.description: Describes basic characteristics of people, animals, objects, places (e.g. He looks..., This is a..., She is very intelligent.)

DA4FE44364D342039C715B4BC078029E.description: nterrupts a conversation politely (e.g. Excuse me. Sorry to interrupt, but…, Before you continue…)

0F27321D0ED7439CB5724918CA7803C2.description: Apologizes and responds to apologies (e.g. I apologize. Sorry, I didn’t mean to…, Don’t worry about it.)

D80C8E5E59FE48BDAB09FB83332804D5.description: Begins/ends telephone exchanges and uses voice mail (e.g. Hello, I’m calling about…,Thank you for calling. Please leave a message after the beep.)

C016AC58208D44739E7FA6662EDCDA88.description: Uses expressions of courtesy (e.g. Please. Thank you very much! You’re more than welcome.)

85CA09D4C57947FCBDD21ECBD6EB9609.description: Takes leave (e.g. Take care! See you later! I have to go.)

6363D9840E3C499FB9EF0E746A5A97BF.description: Greets and responds to greetings (e.g. How are you? Not so bad, and you? What’s new?)

4A30900C2B8943C092523DD7792F642C.description: Compares communication conventions from English-language cultures with own culture

F67DE97B00B34ED1989A2D658F22F60C.description: Explores communication conventions from English-language cultures

F3F2B161C21F4BBBA7010F20091DED1A.description: Sociolinguistic Aspect (i.e. communication conventions such as social conventions, paralinguistic skills, language code, humour)

0BBE8ED4E7F54975BAB4BB7C61364EDF.description: Compares daily life practices from English-language cultures with own culture

0FEA856DE174463397969C9B8A3240C7.description: Explores daily life practices from English-language cultures

19ADD59A5A8449BBB223874CC2FAB946.description: Sociological Aspect (i.e. daily life practices related to areas such as family, relationships, pastimes, customs, heroes, history)

2999AED6ECD14370A3AF1362DAA0850B.description: Compares cultural products from English-language cultures with own culture

899822F276B241BE84C93EE477F83444.description: Explores cultural products from English-language cultures

163D35BAECFA49C8B133A3C59660B9F7.description: Aesthetic Aspect( i.e. cultural products such as cinema, literature, music, media that represent Englishlanguage cultures)
